issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description:
I don't know if this is the right syntax to use, but:
 euca-migrate-instances -i i-19f512f9 --dest="10.111.5.77"


Error(400 Bad Request): Failed to find corresponding class mapping for element: MigrateInstances in namespace: msgs_eucalyptus_com_4_0_0

comments.body: [~sjones] Could this be an issue with service separation (since it appears that MigrateInstances is under compute)?
Possibly, is the request being send to the right endpoint? (i.e. a compute service endpoint, not the localhost)

After manually changing the path to 'services/compute', I'm getting this error:

Wed Apr 9 00:11:41 2014  INFO [Exceptions:Compute.02] [com.eucalyptus.util.Exceptions.trace(Exceptions.java):366] Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{Clu
sterEndpoint.component}. Message payload is of type: MigrateInstancesType
Wed Apr 9 00:11:41 2014  INFO [Exceptions:Compute.02] [com.eucalyptus.util.Exceptions.trace(Exceptions.java):366] Failed to send message MigrateInstancesType to service Eucal
yptusRequestQueueSync because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{ClusterEndpoint.component}. Message payload is of type: MigrateInstancesType
Wed Apr 9 00:11:41 2014  WARN [Contexts:ReplyQueue.02] [com.eucalyptus.context.Contexts.response(Contexts.java):254] Received a reply for absent client:  No channel to write 
response message: Found correlation id 4ececf19-f8fb-4034-add8-66a0c765ddba but no corresponding context. for ExceptionResponseType
Wed Apr 9 00:11:41 2014 DEBUG [ComputeErrorHandler:ComputeErrorQueue.02] [com.eucalyptus.records.BaseRecord.debug(BaseRecord.java):185] :1397027501467:ComputeErrorHandler:MSG_REPLY:MigrateInstancesType

This is working for me when the tool has the right host and service path. If a redirect is required (i.e. you run the command on the CLC and the compute service is on a separate host) then the request fails due to an invalid signature.

{code}

Error(MigrateInstancesType): Failed to lookup requested instance: i-00000000
{code}

Unlike other admin tools the migration tool should use the configured URL for the compute service.
For the above I edited the host and path for the request in "eucadmin/__init__.py".
[~sjones] I confirmed it working from service side. There was another issue and the log confused me.

Another error.

There are likely 2 issues, one in the BE and one in tools
Fix to NC is pushed to testing. Tested and confirmed migration works, after manually changing endpoint in the tool. Once [~gholms] fixes the endpoint issue, it should work fine.
Commit {{63b2a57}} essentially applies the same fix on the client side that I used for EUCA-9128.  All should be well now.

Migrate instance works fine.
